name: User
documentation:
Represents an authenticated or system-level user identity within the Fluxzero Runtime.

A {@code User} provides role-based access information. User instances are propagated through message metadata and can be made available to business logic via {@link User#getCurrent()} or injection into handler methods.

To execute logic with a specific user bound to the current thread context, use {@link #apply(Callable)} or {@link #run(ThrowingRunnable)}. @see UserProvider

fields.name: current
fields.documentation:
Thread-local reference to the current user. Typically managed by the Fluxzero Runtime and automatically
 injected for message handling.

methods.name: apply
getCurrent
hasRole
run
